title: Understand the Formula for Gibbs Free Energy Change
text:
Gibbs free energy change (ΔG) can be calculated using the $$formula:[ΔG=ΔH-TΔS]$$ where:
- ΔH is the enthalpy change
- T is the temperature (in Kelvin)
- ΔS is the entropy change

title: Substitute Values into the Equation
text:
We need to substitute the given values into the formula $$ΔG=ΔH-TΔS$$:
$$-ΔH=40.79$$ $$ rac{kJ}{mol}$$
$$-T=350$$ K
$$-ΔS=109.2$$ $$ rac{J}{K}$$ mol

Make sure to convert(ΔH into the same units as(ΔS. Decide what the values should be after conversion.

title: Convert Units and Calculate the Result
text: Convert the enthalpy change((ΔH) from kilojoules to joules before plugging it into the formula, and then perform the calculations to find(ΔG.\n\n$$Calculate:(40.79$$ × $$1000)-(350$$ × $$109.2)$$.

title: Final Calculation of ΔG
text: Multiply the result from ΔG for $$1$$ mole by $$0.5$$:\n\n$$0.50$$ × (2570)
